DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Segment FFPE Block CPTAC Biospecimen Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The CPTAC specimen identifier of the cassette and Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded (FFPE) block in which the tumor tissue segment was embedded.  The identifier utilizes the pre-defined CPTAC identifier format.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning._Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.:Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The CPTAC specimen identifier in the format of [C3Y]-XXXXX- ZZ where Y is either N for NCI or L for Leidos, XXXXX is the case ID/kit id, and ZZ equals the type of specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium Biospecimen Identifier
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs; applicable to all tumor types.

ReferenceDocuments.name: FFPE QC:  Block ID (QC casset
ReferenceDocuments.description: FFPE QC:  Block ID (QC cassette ID)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Identifiers are in format of C3Y-XXXXX- ZZ where Y is either N for NCI or L for Leidos, XXXXX is the case ID/kit id, ZZ equals the type of specimen.  There is a  pre-defined list of specimen types for CPTAC specimens.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-PATH-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: FFPE QC:  Block ID (QC cassette ID) of the sample from which this slide was derived

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/17/21 jk added CM Path Rpt CSI. 7/12/21 jk added HNSCC Path Rpt CSI. 8/27/20 jk added Procurement CSI, AQT.  4/30/20 jk added CPTAC LGG Path CSI.  4/20/20 jk Def revised per SME review; added AQT and to Slide CSI. 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/7/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs; applicable to all tumor types.
